io.github.ddimitrov.nuggets

Class ExceptionTransformerBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.ddimitrov.nuggets.ExceptionTransformerBuilder

  • public class ExceptionTransformerBuilder
extends Object

    Builds a transformer function manipulating exception messages, stack traces and nesting structure (used internally by Exceptions).

    Most of the methods of this class return the current instance, so they can be chained. We call these configuration methods and their purpose is to define the behaviour of transforming function. Calling configuration method after the transforming function is built is an error.

    The build() method creates a transforming function and returns it. The done() method creates the transforming function and passes it to an action callback specified at construction time - this is useful when a service wants to allow the client to configure a managed transformer. We call these builder methods.

    As a simple rule, when we call methods multiple times, the configuration methods are accumulated, while the builder methods are idempotent. Notable exception is replaceMessage(Function) that can be called only once.

    This class should be used by a single thread. The transforming function, that is returned from build() is threadsafe only if all the function-classes passed to the configuration methods are threadsafe.

    Example:

    
 Function<Throwable, Throwable> cleanup = new ExceptionTransformerBuilder()
           .replaceStackTrace(ExceptionTransformerBuilder.FILTER_GROOVY_SYNTHETIC)
           .filterStackFramesForClass(Pattern.compile("^(java.lang.reflect|sun.reflect).*"))
           .filterStackFramesForClass(Pattern.compile("^(org.codehaus.groovy|org.gradle).*"))
           .unwrapThese(InvocationTargetException.class)
           .unwrapWhen(ex -> ex.getMessage() == null && ex.getClass().equals(RuntimeException.class))
           .build();
 // somewhere in a top-level exception handler
      ....
 } catch (Exception e) {
     logger.error("something really bad happened, cleanup.apply(e));
 }
    See Also:
    Exceptions.transformOnRethrow(), Exceptions.rethrowTransformed(Throwable, boolean)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExceptionTransformerBuilder

        public ExceptionTransformerBuilder()

        Create a builder for exception transformer function, allows to clean up and enrich a stack trace and get rid of insignificant stack frames, so troubleshooters can focus on what matters.

        To use, call the configuring methods by daisy-chaining them, and finally call build() to get the transformer function. If you call a configuring method after that, you would get an IllegalStateException.

      • ExceptionTransformerBuilder

        public ExceptionTransformerBuilder(@Nullable
                                   @Nullable Consumer<Function<Throwable,Throwable>> buildCompleteAction)

        Create a configurer for exception transformer function used by a service component. In the typical use-case, the service will use this constructor and return the builder to the client, who will call the configuring methods by daisy-chaining them, and finally call done(), which will build the result and invoke #buildCompleteAction. The #buildCompleteAction is specified by the service and is not visible to the client - typically it just assigns the passed-in transformer function to a field or a thread-local.

        To use, to publish the transformer function. If you call a configuring method after that, you would get an IllegalStateException.

        Parameters:
        buildCompleteAction - specifies what to do with the function once built. Invoked when the client calls build() or done()
        See Also:
        ExceptionTransformerBuilder()

    • Method Detail

      • build

        @NotNull
public @NotNull Function<Throwable,Throwable> build()

        Creates the configured exception-transformer function and passes it to the buildCompleteAction if one was specified at construction time. Unlike done() this method also returns the transformer function.

        Once this method has been called, any call to a method other than #build() or done() will result in exception.

        Calling this method multiple times has no effect and it will always return the same value.

        Returns:
        the configured exception-transformer function

      • done

        @Nullable
public <T> T done()

        Creates the configured exception-transformer function and passes it to the buildCompleteAction if one was specified at construction time. Unlike build() this method does NOT return the transformer function, but always returns null, inferring the return type.

        Once this method has been called, any call to a method other than build() or #done() will result in exception.

        Calling this method multiple times has no further effects.

        Type Parameters:
        T - inferring the return type.
        Returns:
        the configured exception-transformer function

      • replaceMessage

        @NotNull
public @NotNull ExceptionTransformerBuilder replaceMessage(@NotNull
                                                                    @NotNull Function<Throwable,String> messageMapper)
        If configured, will replace the Throwable.getMessage() of the thrown exception with the mapped value.
        Parameters:
        messageMapper - provide a new message for the passed-in exception.
        Returns:
        the builder instance for chaining
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if a messageMapper has already been specified or the transform function has already been built.

      • unwrapWhen

        @NotNull
public @NotNull ExceptionTransformerBuilder unwrapWhen(@NotNull
                                                                @NotNull Predicate<Throwable> unwrap)
        Specifies predicate to remove wrapped exceptions. Useful when using multiple-layers, where each layer wraps and rethrows an exception. If this method is called multiple times, the specified predicates are OR-ed together.
        Parameters:
        unwrap - if this predicate returns true, the tested exception will be removed from the Throwable.getCause() nesting.
        Returns:
        the builder instance for chaining
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the transform function has already been built.

      • unwrapThese

        @SafeVarargs
 @NotNull
public final @NotNull ExceptionTransformerBuilder unwrapThese(@NotNull
                                                                                     Class<? extends Throwable>... exceptionClasses)
        Specifies to remove wrapped exceptions of certain classes. Useful when using multiple-layers, where each layer wraps and rethrows an exception. If this method is called multiple times, the specified conditions are OR-ed together.
        Parameters:
        exceptionClasses - throwable is removed only if its class matches exactly one of these specifief classes.
        Returns:
        the builder instance for chaining
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the transform function has already been built.

      • replaceStackTrace

        @NotNull
public @NotNull ExceptionTransformerBuilder replaceStackTrace(@NotNull
                                                                       @NotNull Function<StackTraceElement[],StackTraceElement[]> stackMapper)
        Transforms the full stack, allowing to remove frames, add new frames, or putting extra information in existing frames as follows:
        • to remove a frame, just set the array cell to null
        • to add a new frame, allocate a bigger array, copy what you need and add your custom frames where needed
        • to decorate a frame, instantiate a new frame with the data of existing one and modify what you need
        If configured multiple times, the stack mappers are applied in the specified order. That means that some of them may see null frames, leftovers from the previous.
        Parameters:
        stackMapper - the mapping function, as described above
        Returns:
        the builder instance for chaining
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the transform function has already been built.

      • replaceStackFrame

        @NotNull
public @NotNull ExceptionTransformerBuilder replaceStackFrame(@NotNull
                                                                       @NotNull Function<StackTraceElement,StackTraceElement> frameMapper)
        Transforms the stack frames one-by-one, allowing to remove frames, or putting extra information in existing frames as follows:
        • to remove a frame, just return null
        • to decorate a frame, return a new frame, copying and modifying the data of existing one as needed
        • if you need to add a new frame, use replaceStackTrace(Function)
        If configured multiple times, the frame mappers are applied in the specified order.
        Parameters:
        frameMapper - the mapping function, as described above
        Returns:
        the builder instance for chaining
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the transform function has already been built.

      • filterStackFrame

        @NotNull
public @NotNull ExceptionTransformerBuilder filterStackFrame(@NotNull
                                                                      @NotNull Predicate<StackTraceElement> frameFilter)
        Removes stack frames not matching the predicate. If configured multiple times, the frame filters are applied in the specified order.
        Parameters:
        frameFilter - return true if we want to keep this frame; false otherwise.
        Returns:
        the builder instance for chaining
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the transform function has already been built.

      • filterStackFramesForClass

        @NotNull
public @NotNull ExceptionTransformerBuilder filterStackFramesForClass(@NotNull
                                                                               @NotNull Pattern classPattern)
        Removes stack frames whose StackTraceElement.getClassName() matches the specified pattern.
        Parameters:
        classPattern - classes of stack frames to remove.
        Returns:
        the builder instance for chaining
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the transform function has already been built.

      • filterStackFramesForClassPrefix

        @NotNull
public @NotNull ExceptionTransformerBuilder filterStackFramesForClassPrefix(@NotNull
                                                                                     @NotNull String classPrefix)
        Removes stack frames whose StackTraceElement.getClassName() matches the specified prefix.
        Parameters:
        classPrefix - prefix of fully qualified classes of stack frames to remove.
        Returns:
        the builder instance for chaining
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the transform function has already been built.
